In this paper we describe the synthesis of coordination polymers with general chemical formula [Ln(abdc)(Habdc), nH2O]∞ where Ln=La-Eu (except Pm) and 8⩽ n ⩽11. Their dehydration by freeze-drying leads to a new family of porous compounds with general chemical formula [Ln(abdc)(Habdc), 2H2O]∞ where Ln=La-Eu (except Pm). The porosity of the partially dehydrated Nd-containing compound has been evaluated by computational methods to more than 2000m2 g-1. To the best of our knowledge this is the greatest porosity ever reported for lanthanide containing coordination polymers. This is of particular interest as far as heterogeneous catalysis is concerned because this family of compounds involves the lightest lanthanide ions which are well known for their catalytic properties .

Experimental

Synthesis of the microcrystalline powders [Ln(abdc)(Habdc), nH2O]∞ with Ln=La-Eu (except Pm) and 8⩽ n ⩽11

2-Amino-benzene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (H2abdc) was purchased from Acros Organics and used without further purification. Di-sodium amino-terephthalate salt is prepared by addition of two equivalents of sodium hydroxide to a suspension of amino-terephthalic acid in de-ionized water. The obtained solution is then evaporated to dryness. The resulting solid is put in suspension in ethanol and the mixture is stirred and refluxed for 1h. After filtration and drying, a pale yellow powder of di-sodium 2-amino-1,4-benzenedicarboxylate is collected in 90% yield.
